snippet: President Obama, once determined to change a political system “that’s divided us for too long,” has adopted an unconciliatory strategy for achieving his goals.
abstract: Political Memo; Pres Obama's immigration action made clear his determination to direct his focus on his governing objectives, despite bludgeoning Democratic Party suffered in midterms; Obama has appeared to conclude that pursuing bipartisan reconciliation in his final two years in office is a fool's chase and has turned instead on advancing the policy goals he embraced as a candidate.
lead_paragraph: President Obama, once determined to change a political system “that’s divided us for too long,” has adopted an unconciliatory strategy for achieving his goals.

headline.main: For Obama, a Go-It-Alone Push Fits the Times
headline.print_headline: A Go-It-Alone Push Fits the Times

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
